title: Katherine Musallam Environmental science-Erosion and ranching practices   Feb. 18-22

tasks.task: Discussing soil degradation and conservation methods
subtasks: Explain soil erosion
Describe the role of plants in soil protection
List farmer practices to reduce erosion (intercropping, crop rotation, shelter belts, conservation, terracing, contour farming)
Explain ranching practices and their effects on soil (overgrazing, compaction, exposure, invasive species, reduced air and water pores)

tasks.task: Presenting the week's overview on soil degradation and conservation
subtasks: Welcome students and introduce topic
Summarize the definition and causes of soil erosion
Highlight the importance of plants in soil conservation
Present specific farming techniques to prevent erosion
Discuss the impact of poor ranching practices on soil health
Mention the upcoming activities (posters, research, real-life connections)

tasks.task: Explaining the structure and components of soil
subtasks: Describe the process of soil formation
Explain the different layers of soil and their functions
Discuss the impact of human activities on soil degradation

tasks.task: Introducing conservation techniques for sustainable agriculture
subtasks: Explain the concept of conservation agriculture
Detail practices such as reduced soil disturbance, cover cropping, and crop rotation
Highlight the benefits of conservation practices for soil health

tasks.task: Addressing the challenge of invasive species in agricultural ecosystems
subtasks: Define invasive species and their impact on soil
Discuss prevention and management strategies

tasks.task: Developing educational materials related to soil conservation
subtasks: Plan and design posters related to soil degradation and conservation
Formulate research questions based on the topic
Connect the subject matter to real-life situations and local issues
Investigate different farming methods that reduce soil erosion
Evaluate the impact of current conservation practices on soil health
Propose new strategies for protecting soil in agricultural settings
